title: House Republicans rush to Trump's defense over Georgia call as Democrats prep censure resolution
'It's a dark place': Call reveals a President consumed
description: President Donald Trump had been trying for weeks to get Georgia's secretary of state on the phone.

title: Google workers have formed the company's first-ever union
description: Hundreds of employees at Google and its parent, Alphabet, have launched a union, a rare step for the tech industry that also represents the biggest and most organized challenge yet to the company's executive leadership.

title: Boris Johnson imposes strict national lockdown for England
description:
• LIVE: Lockdown will last until at least mid-February, Johnson says
• Tokyo poised for state of emergency
• India embarks on one of the world's most ambitious vaccine rollouts

title: Dow tumbles on first trading day of 2021
description: The Dow tumbled more than 600 points around midday Monday, the first trading day of the New Year, as investors grew worried about the the pandemic and the economic recovery in 2021.

title: As Democrats prep a censure resolution, some Republican members back the President's actions
Trump's call could put the President in jeopardy, legal experts say
description: Experienced prosecutors, election lawyers and some public officials have piled on calling for criminal investigations into whether President Donald Trump broke election fraud when he pressured Georgia officials on a phone call Saturday to "find" 11,870 votes that would reverse his loss in the state.

title: Something very important happened in the US House on Sunday night
description: Unless you are a very close student of politics, you likely don't know the name Chip Roy.

title: Boris Johnson imposes strict lockdown for England
Trump directed Pentagon to reverse decision and keep aircraft carrier in Middle East amid Iran tensions
description: At the direction of President Donald Trump, acting Secretary of Defense Christopher Miller ordered a US aircraft carrier to return to the Middle East following a White House meeting Sunday, according to a senior defense official.

title: In majority-Black Georgia county, voting in Senate runoffs is more about fight to vote than right to vote
description: Johnny Thornton stood on his sprawling catfish farm, once a symbol of empowerment in this majority Black county, and explained how the local election board once tried to strip him of his right to vote.

title: Vulva-esque sculpture causes a stir
description: A huge concrete sculpture that looks like a human vulva has caused a stir in Brazil.

title: Stunning satellite images capture 2020's extreme climate events
description: As we move into the new year, it's easy to see that things changed for a lot of people in 2020.

title: Women are finally driving Moscow's subway trains after a decades-long ban
description: Trains on the Moscow's famous Metro subway system will now be driven by women, after a decades-long ban on female drivers was overturned.

title: Slack welcomes workers back with a service outage
description: New year, same telecommuting headaches.

title: UK judge denies US request to extradite Julian Assange
description: A British judge has rejected a US request to extradite WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange to America, ruling that such a move would be "oppressive."

title: Iran seizes tanker as tensions rise with US
description: Iran has restarted uranium enrichment toward a 20% target at its Fordow nuclear facility, a government spokesman said on Monday, according to the semi-official news agency Mehr and state news agency IRNA.

title: Tanya Roberts, Bond Girl and 'That 70s Show' actress, has died
description: Actress Tanya Roberts, who is best known for her role as a Bond girl in "A View to a Kill" and for her parts in "Charlie's Angels" and "That '70s Show," has died. She was 65.

title: Biden inaugural festivities to feature national day of service on MLK Day
description: President-elect Joe Biden's inaugural committee will promote the national day of service on Martin Luther King Jr. Day as part of festivities ahead of the inauguration on January 20.

title: Analysis: The 37 most outrageous lines from Trump's call
description: Over the weekend, President Donald Trump spent an hour on the phone with Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger (R) in an attempt to convince the state's top election official to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election in the state. Even for Trump, it was a remarkable moment -- an attempt to lean on an elections official to find more votes that would somehow alter the outcome of the election.

title: MGM makes $11 billion bid for UK gambling group
description: MGM Resorts International is attempting to buy the owner of British gambling brand Ladbrokes, making it the latest US casino operator to place a significant wager on the fast-growing online betting industry during the pandemic.

title: Nashville bomber mailed materials with his viewpoints to acquaintances, FBI says
description: The man who detonated a vehicle bomb in downtown Nashville on Christmas morning sent "materials which espoused his viewpoints" to several acquaintances throughout the country, FBI public affairs officer Darrell DeBusk told CNN.

title: Raffensperger speaks out after Trump tape release
description: During an appearance on ABC's "Good Morning America," Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger says President Donald Trump continues to believe conspiracy theories about his election loss.

title: We're entering year two of the pandemic. Here's what happens next
description: Our global coronavirus nightmare is entering its second year, and we're hanging on the best we can.

title: Sia defends her decision to cast Maddie Ziegler in 'Music'
description: Sia is explaining why she cast Maddie Ziegler rather than an actor with autism in her new movie, "Music."

title: This Trump Senate ally is leading the futile effort to overturn the election result
description: Republican Sen. Josh Hawley threw a political grenade into Washington last week when he announced his intentions to object when Congress counts the Electoral College votes on Wednesday -- a move that pits the youngest senator against Senate GOP leadership as well as some rank-and-file members who will now have to cast a highly consequential vote as a result of his decision.

title: Mental health is one of the biggest pandemic issues we'll face in 2021
description: With progress in efforts for Covid-19 vaccines and predictions for when the population will receive them, there seems to be a light at the end of the long, harrowing pandemic tunnel.

title: Bitcoin's rally could be a sign of what's in store for markets in 2021
description: Investors are gearing up for a turbocharged 2021. Want evidence? Look at the price of Bitcoin.

title: A photographer secretly snapped strangers' text messages and turned them into art
description: Before social distancing, it was easy to catch a glimpse of someone's text messages while waiting on a crowded subway platform or standing in line; allowing your eyes to linger a second longer than you should. Photographer Jeff Mermelstein has used this common impulse to create a series of photos, surreptitiously taken over the shoulders of strangers.

title: Alexi Laiho, front man for Finnish metal band Children of Bodom, dies suddenly
description: Alexi Laiho, front man for Finnish metal band Children of Bodom and supergroup Bodom After Midnight, has died, his record label has confirmed.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo surpasses Pele to become second-highest goalscorer of all time
description: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice in Juventus' 4-1 win over Udinese on Sunday to surpass Brazil legend Pele and become the second-highest goalscorer in history.

title: Where is Jack Ma? Tech tycoon silent as China gets tough with his business
description: Jack Ma's businesses are under enormous pressure right now. But the co-founder of China's most successful tech empire and legendary billionaire entrepreneur hasn't been heard from in months.

title: She lost her dad and uncle to coronavirus. Trump's claim that the virus is exaggerated is an insult, she says
description: Most New Year's Days, Rosa Cerna would be celebrating the birthdays of her dad and uncle -- brothers born exactly one year apart. This year, she mourned them both at a cemetery in Simi Valley, California.

title: 100 people killed in attacks on Niger villages, says prime minister
description: One hundred people were killed on Saturday in attacks on two villages in western Niger, Prime Minister Brigi Rafini said following one of the deadliest days in recent memory for a country ravaged by Islamist violence.

title: South Korea reports population drop, with more deaths than births for first time
description: South Korea recorded more deaths than births in 2020 for the first time ever, prompting calls for action to revive the country's falling fertility rate.

title: The world's safest airlines for 2021 revealed
description: There may have been far fewer airplanes in the skies this past year, but if you're looking ahead to future travel, you might take heed of the latest rankings of the world's safest airlines from AirlineRatings.com.

title: Wall Street will kick out three big Chinese telecom companies
description: Washington's battle with Beijing is escalating once more on Wall Street.

title: Bali's Kuta Beach cleared of tons of plastic waste
description: Tons of trash have washed onto Bali's famous Kuta Beach, prompting locals to spend the first day of the new year staging a cleanup.

title: Hear portions from the Trump phone call with Georgia Secretary of State
description: In excerpts from an hourlong phone call, President Donald Trump pushed Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to "find" votes to overturn the election results after his loss to President-elect Joe Biden, according to an audio recording of a phone call obtained by CNN and first reported by the Washington Post. The White House declined to comment to CNN. CNN has reached out to Raffensperger.

title: Lawmaker's message to fellow Republicans after Trump call
description: Rep. Adam Kinzinger (R-IL) says he feels alone on an island in the Republican Party after fellow lawmakers double down their support of President Donald Trump after audio was released between Trump and Georgia's Secretary of State.

title: A ring with 12,638 diamonds sets a Guinness World Record
description: How many diamonds can fit in a single ring?
